attributes.action: Introduce child parking permits to parents of children aged 5 and under
attributes.background: Since having my baby, I have found it almost impossible to park in a child parking bay when food shopping etc, as drivers with no children are taking them up instead. I think it would be beneficial, for parents of children aged 5 and under, to have the opportunity to apply for a child parking permit

rejection.details:
Parking schemes and permits are usually the responsibility of your local council. If you'd like a scheme like this in your local area, then you could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

If you'd like the scheme to be available in the whole of the UK, you could start a petition asking for that.
